# About Me

üëã Hello! I am a Data Staff Scientist at the 
[Fred Hutch Data Science Lab][dasl]. My work is focused on understanding 
[data science as a practice][fifty-years], building a better 
[developer experience][jean-yang] for data scientists, and creating better
outcomes in [digital education][jeff-leek]. I approach these challenges with
computational, statistical, ethnographic, and design-driven methods.

Previously I earned my PhD in Human-Computer Interaction at the University of 
California San Diego where I was advised by [Philip Guo][pg]. During my PhD I
interned at the [Research in Software Engineering Group][rise-msr] and the 
[Computational Social Science Group][css-msr] at Microsoft Research.
Before I started graduate school I was the Chief Technology Officer at the 
[Johns Hopkins Data Science Lab][jhu-dsl]. I am also a frequent consultant for 
data analysis and software development projects, in addition to being
a maintainer of several open source software projects.
